title: Help/error messages in a for iteration

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
fn main() {
    let v = &mut *vec![0_u32; 100];
    for &x in v {
        let _x: u32 = x;
    }
}
```

Gives this error message (rustc 1.60.0-nightly 84322efad 2022-01-23):

```rust
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> ...\test.rs:3:9
  |
3 |     for &x in v {
  |         ^^    - this expression has type `Option<&mut u32>`
  |         |
  |         types differ in mutability
  |         help: you can probably remove the explicit borrow: `x`
  |
  = note: expected mutable reference `&mut u32`
                     found reference `&_`
```

I am not sure but I think there's something sub-optimal in this error message. The `Option<&mut u32>` seems to come out of nothing. And the help seems off.

Ideally it should suggest instead:

```rust
for &x in v.iter() {
```
